intro: Hackelia patens var. semiglabra, commonly known as the smooth hackelia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, which distinguishes it from other varieties of Hackelia. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable plant for rock gardens and xeriscaping. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
